Text:
its prolly like with the old winserver2008 days.... install eval, dont use any keys at all, purchase proper edition and use key on eval installed system.

http://www.paklinks.com/gs/computer-information-technology/325020-windows-server-2008-trial-install-licensed.html#post6606150

it used to be the way in server 2008 at least, that you could go from eval to both retail and volumelicensing just by using the serialnumber you buy, but you cannot go oem (serialnumber), as that works differently.

look at darrell gorter's (microsoft dev team et. al.) post at:
http://www.eggheadcafe.com/conversation.aspx?messageid=33200656&threadid=33200648

thx for the app if anyone need rs link 

openwindows7 wordpress com

@torrentshredder thanks for sharing, Yes OEM works differently, they require a SLIC table in the BIOS and a matching certificate installed.

The question is, if I have the requirements above (assuming that an OEM key will be leaked), can I use this ISO?
